drupalNodeEvent.title: China’s Hukou System: How an Engine of Development Has Now Become a Major Obstacle

field_organizers.processed: Harvard University Fairbank Center For Chinese Studies

field_description.processed: As the People’s Republic of China has pursued economic development over the decades, a central dilemma concerns how to treat its massive rural population, and the extent to which its rural-origin citizens can contribute to, and benefit from, economic growth. In different time periods, there have been dramatic changes in the nature of rural-urban relations, often with paradoxical consequences for prospects for economic growth. The talk will examine the nature of rural-urban relations in different time periods, with a focus on post-1978 changes.
